programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc).

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Lovable blue gnomes---only three apples high---live an idyllic existence in a medieval forest, though their happiness is threatened by the wicked wizard Gargamel. `The Smurfs' can be traced back to 1958, when Belgian cartoonist Pierre `Peyo' Culliford created the mushroom-dwelling creatures. They debuted on American toy shelves in the late-1970s before appearing on NBC's Saturday-morning schedule. The show was a huge success, expanding from an hour to 90 minutes in 1982 and garnering two Emmys. (cc).

programme.title: The Jetsons
programme.desc: Hanna-Barbera's space-age counterpoint to their `Flintstones,' featuring George Jetson, wife Jane and their kids, Elroy and Judy. `The Jetsons' was memorable for (apart from a nifty theme song) goofy futuristic gadgets, such as a robot maid and a car that turned into a briefcase. It aired for one season in prime time on ABC, but those episodes were repeated on Saturday mornings on three networks off and on over the next 20 years. More episodes were produced for syndication in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Rock-solid animated sitcom about a Stone Age family in the prehistoric town of Bedrock that played out like a cartoon version of `The Honeymooners.' The series, originally titled `The Flagstones,' was TV's first prime-time cartoon. It later thrived in syndication and spawned many incarnations, including `The Flintstone Kids' (which cast Fred, Wilma, Barney and Betty as 10-year-olds), specials (such as a 1993 one in which Pebbles married Bamm Bamm) and theatrical films (in 1994 and 2000).(n)

programme.title: The '84 Draft
programme.desc: A retrospective on the 1984 NBA Draft, which produced four Hall of Famers (Michael Jordan, Charles Barkley); several more All-Stars (Alvin Robertson, Kevin Willis); and an array of other notable players (Leon Wood, Rick Carlisle). Steve Nash narrates. (cc).

programme.title: Clutch City
programme.desc: A 20th anniversary look at the Houston Rockets' back-to-back NBA titles in 1994-95. Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler, Robert Horry, Sam Cassell and Rudy Tomjanovich are among those reflecting back on the wins over New York and Orlando. (cc).

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: The definitive look at Julius "Dr. J" Erving's life and career—growing up in New York, playing in (and carrying) the ABA, and winning an NBA title with the Philadelphia 76ers. Also discussed is his life after retiring from basketball. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kobe The Interview
programme.desc: Lakers guard Kobe Bryant reflects on his career and his future in an in-depth sit-down with Ahmad Rashad. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Announcement
programme.desc: Chronicling former Lakers star Earvin "Magic" Johnson's life since his startling 1991 revelation that he was HIV-positive. Johnson's wife, Cookie, is among those interviewed, along with Pat Riley, Arsenio Hall and Larry Bird. Directed by Nelson George. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Magic & Bird A Courtship of Rivals
programme.desc: The rivalry and friendship between NBA Hall of Famers Larry Bird and Magic Johnson during their peak is the focus of this documentary. Included are clips from their college and NBA battles, and interviews with coaches and teammates, including Pat Riley, Kevin McHale and Michael Cooper. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Allen Iverson The Answer
programme.desc: Four-time NBA scoring champ and 2001 MVP Allen Iverson discusses his career and impending enshrinement in the Basketball Hall of Fame. Coaches John Thompson and Larry Brown also comment on the talented, fearless, authentic and often-misunderstood guard. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Bluegrass Kingdom The Gospel of Kentucky Basketball

programme.title: Duke 91 & 92 Back to Back
programme.desc: A documentary looking at the Duke Blue Devils' back-to-back NCAA championship seasons in 1991 and 1992; including interviews with coach Mike Krzyzewski and players including Grant Hill, Christian Laettner and Bobby Hurley. Also: highlights of a 20th anniversary gathering at Cameron Indoor Stadium in Durham. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the early 1990s Arkansas basketball dynasty under coach Nolan Richardson, whose signature full-court pressure wore down opponents. Former President Bill Clinton is among those interviewed in an in-depth look at Richardson's career. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the tornado-interrupted 2008 SEC men's basketball tournament in Atlanta, where Georgia Dome damage forced a frantic move to Georgia Tech. programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.sub-title: Courage Matters: The C.M. Newton Story
programme.desc: Chronicling C.M. Newton's influence on the basketball world in a career spanning seven decades (in the SEC and with Team USA) as an innovator and an advocate for the advancement of African-Americans in athletics. Directed by Jonathan Hock. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: A teenage Dominique Wilkins was the star of Washington (N.C.) High, leading the Pam Pack to two state titles. But when he chose Georgia over local ACC schools, the jeers left 'Nique distrustful of fans until the Georgia community convinced him otherwise and paved the way for his return home. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the career of Missouri basketball icon Norm Stewart, a multi-sport standout before becoming the basketball program's all-time wins leader. Jon Sundvold, Jay Bilas, Roy Williams and Stewart's wife Virginia are among those interviewed. (cc).

programme.desc: A teenage Dominique Wilkins was the star of Washington (N.C.) High, leading the Pam Pack to two state titles. But when he chose Georgia over local ACC schools, the jeers left 'Nique distrustful of fans until the Georgia community convinced him otherwise and paved the way for his return home. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling former LSU hurdler Lolo Jones' unsettled upbringing in Iowa and her track accomplishments in the SEC and beyond. LSU coach Dennis Shaver and Olympic legend Jackie Joyner-Kersee are among those interviewed. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Profiling U.S. soccer star Abby Wambach, a two-time SEC player of the year who sparked Florida to the conference's first NCAA title, over powerhouse North Carolina in 1998. Wambach's upbringing in Rochester and World Cup heroics are also chronicled. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling former Kentucky assistant Bernadette Locke, who Rick Pitino made the second female coach in Division I men's basketball in 1990. The former star guard at Georgia earned the respect of fellow coaches like Billy Donovan and Tubby Smith, bringing knowledge, spirit and academic discipline to the undermanned Wildcats. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Profiling former Arkansas golfer Stacy Lewis, who overcame scoliosis to become an LPGA star. Lewis also donated an entire winner's check in August 2017 to Hurricane Harvey relief efforts in her native Houston. Directed by Kenan Holley. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Swimming analyst and Olympic gold medalist Rowdy Gaines is featured in a look at his college career at Auburn under coach Richard Quick. Gaines won gold in three events at the 1984 Los Angeles Games. Directed by Hannah Storm. (cc).

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling mercurial former Ole Miss basketball scoring sensation Johnny Neumann (1969-71) and the decisions he made that shaped his life and career forever. Interviews include Hubie Brown, Paul Finebaum and Woody Paige. Directed by Paul Carruthers. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: LSU basketball icon "Pistol" Pete Maravich is chronicled by director Fritz Mitchell. A dribbling, passing and scoring genius, Pete was mentored by his father Press and starred in college and the NBA. He would die at the age of 40, on a basketball court. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the early 1990s Arkansas basketball dynasty under coach Nolan Richardson, whose signature full-court pressure wore down opponents. Former President Bill Clinton is among those interviewed in an in-depth look at Richardson's career. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the Alabama-Georgia women's gymnastics rivalry under long-time coaches Sarah Patterson and Suzanne Yoculan. The once-endangered programs combined for over 20 SEC championships and 14 NCAA titles. Directed by Joie Jacoby. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the Florida Gators' back-to-back basketball titles in 2006 and 2007 under Billy Donovan, with Joakim Noah heading a core of players who remained in Gainesville to go for a second championship. Directed by Jonathan Hock. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Profiling former Georgia running back Herschel Walker. The 1982 Heisman Trophy winner overcame teenage bouts with bullying for being overweight and having a severe stutter. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.sub-title: The Play That Changed College Football
programme.desc: Chronicling the 1992 Alabama-Florida SEC title game, the first of its kind in college football. Shane Matthews and Antonio Langham are among the players who discuss a key late play in Alabama's win. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling Sylvester Croom's rise to head football coach at Mississippi State in 2003, making him the first African-American to hold such a position in the SEC. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.sub-title: The Color Orange: The Condredge Holloway Story
programme.desc: Former University of Tennessee QB Condredge Holloway's career is documented, with narration by Kenny Chesney. Holloway starred with the Vols in the 1970s, but that did not lead to pro success in the U.S. at a time when the NFL had few black QBs. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: A look at Auburn's elite '80s athletic trio of Charles Barkley, Bo Jackson and Frank Thomas. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the 2013 Auburn football season under coach Gus Malzahn, who led an epic Tigers turnaround from 2012 in a year of implausible finishes, cinematic heroics, games for the ages and, eventually, the symbolic return of the oaks at Toomer's Corner. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Network Yule Log
programme.desc: A mix of Southeastern Conference college fight songs and holiday music accompany a fireplace scene. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Network Yule Log
programme.desc: A mix of Southeastern Conference college fight songs and holiday music accompany a fireplace scene. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling the career of running back George Rogers, South Carolina's only Heisman Trophy winner (1980). Teammates, coaches and Rogers himself reflect on his impact on the Gamecocks and in the pros with the Saints and Redskins. Directed by James Weiner. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling Athens native Fran Tarkenton's rise as Georgia Bulldogs QB, culminating in the 1959 SEC title, and his NFL exploits with the Vikings and Giants. A succesful entrepreneur, Tarkenton returns to campus in 2018. Jay Jackson and Ryan Kelly direct. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: There is no more hallowed figure in sports journalism than Vanderbilt grad Grantland Rice, who maintained a ruling perch across the sports world for more than 50 years. This film relives sport's golden era through a reporter who had a front row seat. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The story of former football coach Robert "Bo" Rein, who was hired by LSU just weeks before he perished in a plane crash in January 1980. A former two-sport standout at Ohio State, Rein had led N.C. State to the 1979 ACC title. Directed by Brian Goodwin. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling former Florida Gators QB Danny Wuerffel's journey from winning the Heisman Trophy and a national title to spearheading the Desire Street Academy in New Orleans, and leading the community program's recovery efforts after Hurricane Katrina. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chornicling the life of former Alabama linebacker Derrick Thomas, who overcame the loss of his father at age 5 and a troubled upbringing in Miami to become a College and Pro Football Hall of Famer and an NFL Man of the Year for charitable contributions. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling Jerry Jones and Jimmy Johnson in their days as Arkansas football teammates--part of an undefeated national champion squad in 1964--long before joining forces to win two Super Bowls with the Dallas Cowboys. Directed by Corey Frost. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Exploring the origin of Gatorade, a product of Dr. Robert Cade's 1960s mission in Gainesville to better hydrate University of Florida athletes in the area's heat and humidity. Directed by David Beilinson and Neil Amdur. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The inspirational story of Ole Miss DB Chucky Mullins and Vanderbilt RB Brad Gaines following their 1989 on-field collision that broke Mullins' neck, leaving him a quadriplegic. Gaines was by Mullins' side when he died of a blood clot two years later. Directed by Fritz Mitchell. (cc).(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling Sylvester Croom's rise to head football coach at Mississippi State in 2003, making him the first African-American to hold such a position in the SEC. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Part 5
programme.desc: On the day of the escape, Matt and Sweat know the smallest mistake can derail their whole plan. But when a stern corrections officer takes over the post in the tailor shop and fellow inmate Murder gets out of the Special Housing Unit, Matt seems attracted to the danger. Tilly and Lyle have a fateful dinner at an all-you-can-eat Chinese restaurant.

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: A team of investigative journalists in Boston shocks the city and the world by exposing the Catholic Church's systematic cover-up of widespread child molestation perpetrated by more than 70 local priests.

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. The stories of Special Agent Richard Deslauriers (Kevin Bacon), Police Commissioner Ed Davis (John Goodman), Sergeant Jeffrey Pugliese (J.K. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.

programme.title: American Dream / American Knightmare
programme.desc: Documentary that delves deep into the life and storied exploits of the iconic Death Row Records co-founder Suge Knight, as well as the volatile and highly influential era in gangsta rap he presided over. Through a series of interviewers face to face with director Antoine Fuqua, Knight reveals exactly how it all happened and why it all fell apart. Knight is currently in jail pending trial on murder, attempted-murder and hit-and-run charges.

programme.title: Part 5
programme.desc: On the day of the escape, Matt and Sweat know the smallest mistake can derail their whole plan. But when a stern corrections officer takes over the post in the tailor shop and fellow inmate Murder gets out of the Special Housing Unit, Matt seems attracted to the danger. Tilly and Lyle have a fateful dinner at an all-you-can-eat Chinese restaurant.(c)

programme.title: Who Once Was Dead
programme.desc: Ray works to make things right with Sam, but she has her own ideas about controlling damage. Bunchy comes back to New York with some missing goods. Terry spends the night with someone from his past. Bridget pays the price for her father’s actions.(c)

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Violence, Brief Nudity

programme.title: 48 Hrs.
programme.desc: A streetwise convict (Eddie Murphy) teams up with a cantankerous cop (Nick Nolte) to track down two cold-blooded killers.

programme.title: Backdraft
programme.desc: Two Chicago firefighter brothers, who don't get along, have to work together while a dangerous arsonist is on the loose.

programme.title: 2018 Week 15
programme.desc: This week on INSIDE THE NFL: are the Los Angeles Chargers the team to beat in the AFC and is this the beginning of the end for Bill Belichick, Tom Brady and the New England Patriots? Also, predictions for which teams will be playing in the postseason.(c)

programme.title: Major League
programme.desc: The new owner of the Cleveland Indians puts together a purposely-horrible team so they'll lose and she can move the team. But when the plot is uncovered, they start winning just to spite her.

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: Ben Stiller is back as Gaylord "Greg" Focker, the unlucky fiancé who must endure another humiliating parental exchange. Having given him their daughter's hand, Jack and Dina Byrnes (Oscar® winner Robert De Niro and Blythe Danner) now travel to Florida to meet Greg's parents - a couple who couldn't be more different from the ex-CIA agent and his wife. Oscar® winners Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand co-star as the eccentric Fockers.

programme.title: A Bad Moms Christmas
programme.desc: Three under-appreciated and over-burdened women rebel against the challenges and expectations of the Super Bowl for moms: Christmas. And if creating a more perfect holiday for their families wasn't hard enough, they have to do all of that while hosting and entertaining their own mothers.

programme.title: Rising
programme.desc: A Muslim family and their diverse neighbors struggle to survive rising floodwaters and bias in the heart of America.

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Having lost his memory and the one person he loved, Jason Bourne is forced to hunt down his past in order to find a future. Traveling from Moscow, Paris and London to Tangier and New York City, he continues his quest to find the real Jason Bourne - all the while trying to outmaneuver the scores of cops, federal officers and Interpol agents who have him in their crosshairs.

programme.title: Who Once Was Dead

programme.title: American Assassin
programme.desc: The story of the rise of Mitch Rapp (Dylan O'Brien), a CIA black ops recruit under the instruction of Cold War veteran Stan Hurley (Michael Keaton). The pair is enlisted by CIA Deputy Director Irene Kennedy (Sanaa Lathan) to investigate a wave of apparently random attacks on both military and civilian targets. Together the three discover a pattern in the violence leading them to a joint mission with a lethal Turkish agent (Shiva Negar) to stop a mysterious operative (Taylor Kitsch) intent on starting a World War.

programme.title: Part 5
programme.desc: On the day of the escape, Matt and Sweat know the smallest mistake can derail their whole plan. But when a stern corrections officer takes over the post in the tailor shop and fellow inmate Murder gets out of the Special Housing Unit, Matt seems attracted to the danger. Tilly and Lyle have a fateful dinner at an all-you-can-eat Chinese restaurant.(c)

programme.title: Dream On
programme.desc: Ray struggles to get the help he so desperately needs, causing Bridget to learn some hard truths about her father. Ray makes a move to save both Novak’s campaign and Mac’s life. Mickey sees an opportunity to recoup some of his losses. Darryl and Sandy find common ground.(c)

programme.title: Part 6
programme.desc: In a deep dive into the minds of these individuals, we finally see what Matt and Sweat are capable of outside the prison walls. Tilly’s natural instincts aren’t much better.(c)

Traveling from Moscow, Paris and London to Tangier and New York City, he continues his quest to find the real Jason Bourne - all the while trying to outmaneuver the scores of cops, federal officers and Interpol agents who have him in their crosshairs.

programme.title: Korn's Brian "Head" Welch: Loud Krazy Love
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the sound Brian "Head" Welch pioneered with KoRn in the early ‘90s provided identity to a generation of misfits and made him a global rock star. However, Brian's life takes a turn when he walks out on a $23M record deal in order to become a good father to his daughter.(c)

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: A talented young getaway driver (Ansel Elgort) relies on the beat of his personal soundtrack to be the best in the game. When he meets the girl of his dreams (Lily James), Baby sees a chance to ditch his criminal life and make a clean getaway. But after being coerced into working for a crime boss (Kevin Spacey), he must face the music when a doomed heist threatens his life, love and freedom.

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Writer, director and star Tyler Perry returns to his signature role in this comedy-drama that finds family matriarch Madea juggling several romantic crises involving her nieces' relationships as well as the funeral of an older sister - all on the weekend that her entire clan is gathering for a reunion. Cicely Tyson, Blair Underwood, Lynn Whitfield and Maya Angelou costar.

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: Just when he's needed most, wily pirate Captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) is trapped on a sea of sand in Davy Jones' Locker. In an increasingly shaky alliance, Will Turner (Orlando Bloom), Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) and Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) begin a desperate quest to find and rescue him. Captain Jack's the last of the nine Pirate Lords of the Brethren Court who must come together united in one last stand to preserve the freedom-loving pirates' way of life.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.

programme.title: The Death of Stalin
programme.desc: In the days following Stalin's collapse, his core team of ministers tussle for control; some want positive change in the Soviet Union, others have more sinister motives. Their one common trait? They're all just desperately trying to remain alive. The internal political landscape of 1950's Soviet Russia takes on darkly comic form in a new film courtesy of Emmy® award winning and Oscar® nominated writer/director Armando Iannucci.

programme.title: Dream On
programme.desc: Ray struggles to get the help he so desperately needs, causing Bridget to learn some hard truths about her father. Ray makes a move to save both Novak’s campaign and Mac’s life. Mickey sees an opportunity to recoup some of his losses. Darryl and Sandy find common ground.(c)

programme.title: Quantum of Solace
programme.desc: Daniel Craig returns as British secret agent James Bond in this sequel that finds the dapper, lethal spy pursuing the villains behind the death of his murdered lover and uncovering a sinister global organization bent on world domination. Olga Kurylenko and Mathieu Amalric costar in this dazzling follow-up.(n)

programme.title: Part 6
programme.desc: In a deep dive into the minds of these individuals, we finally see what Matt and Sweat are capable of outside the prison walls. Tilly’s natural instincts aren’t much better.(n)

programme.title: Sommore: A Queen With No Spades
programme.desc: Sommore is back for her 4th self-produced comedy special. Filmed at the Beautiful Faena Theater in Miami Beach, she covers topics ranging from her own personal growth and development, to her unique perspective on life, politics and individual choice.(n)

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Writer, director and star Tyler Perry returns to his signature role in this comedy-drama that finds family matriarch Madea juggling several romantic crises involving her nieces' relationships as well as the funeral of an older sister - all on the weekend that her entire clan is gathering for a reunion. Cicely Tyson, Blair Underwood, Lynn Whitfield and Maya Angelou costar.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
